content:
• Wednesday, April 3, 2019

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: MKTX +3.8%. WTRE +3.1%. CBLK +3.1%. PRNB +2.1%. VALE +1.7%.
    • Losers: NSPR -28.5%. RECN -10.6%. SGMO -7.4%. PARR -4.8%. VRAY -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • PSTI

    Pluristem -12.9% on proposed public offering, direct offering

    • Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) is 12.9% lower after hours following a proposal to offer shares and warrants in a public offering, along with a concurrent registered direct offering.
    • Via Ladenburg Thalmann, the company will sell all shares and warrants.
    • The underwriter will get a 30-day greenshoe option to buy up to an additional 15% of shares/warrants in the public offering.
    • Proceeds of both offerings will fund research and product development activities, clinical trial activities, investment in capital equipment and general purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 51 Comments
  • CBLK

    Carbon Black +3% on Outperform start

    • Baird starts Carbon Black (NASDAQ:CBLK) at Outperform with a $20 price target, implying a 43% upside.
    • In February, CBLK shares plunged after the Q4 report included a downside Q1 outlook and notice of the CFO's departure. The company has since filled the role with EMC veteran Steve Webber.
    • Carbon Black shares are up 3% after hours to $14.45.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • SMAR

    Smartsheet gains on Outperform start

    • Oppenheimer initiates Smartsheet (NYSE:SMAR) at Outperform with a $50 price target.
    • The rating is a return to strength for SMAR, which received its first Neutral rating last month when D.A. Davidson went against the Buy-equivalent grain.
    • Smartsheet shares are up 1.5% after hours to $40.80.
    • Update with more information about the upgrade:
    • Analyst Ittai Kidron says the strong rally is likely to continue with more customer adds and deeper penetration into existing ones.
    • Kidron sees incremental TAM expansion as the company expands its platform to address more use cases.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • STZ

    Constellation to sell ~30 wine brands to Gallo in $1.7B deal

    • Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) -1.5% after-hours after agreeing to sell ~30 brands from its wine and spirits portfolio and related facilities to E. & J. Gallo Winery for $1.7B.
    • STZ says the wine and spirits brands to be sold, such as Clos du Bois, Black Box and Mark West, are principally priced at $11 retail and below, and do not include its Robert Mondavi, Prisoner Wine, Kim Crawford, Ruffino, Meiomi and SVEDKA Vodka brands.
    • STZ says the sale, which confirms earlier speculation, better aligns its portfolio with consumer premiumization trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 17 Comments
  • LYV

    Live Nation -1.6% after Evercore moves to sidelines

    • Live Nation (NYSE:LYV) is off 1.6% after hours following a downgrade to In-Line by Evercore ISI, from Outperform.
    • Closing at $64.82 today, the stock's hit analyst David Joyce's price target of $64, he says. And the stock's absolute and relative EV/EBITDA multiple has hit a 10-year high.
    • He still likes the business model, growth opportunities and execution track record but sees some challenging Ticketing AOI comps in a seasonally light Q1. (h/t Bloomberg)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • REPH

    Recro Pharma up 17% on reorg plan, bullish outlook

    • Taking action after the FDA rejected IV meloxicam a second time, Recro Pharma (NASDAQ:REPH) has launched a cost-cutting initiative in its Acute Care business, including the termination of about 50 employees, that it believes will significantly lower operating expenses and cash consumption. Management says the move will result in breakeven cash flow in Q3 and positive cash flow in Q4.
    • The company plans to meet with the FDA to discuss the second CRL and clarify a registration path forward while vetting potential commercialization partners for the product.
    • In a show of confidence, management has upped its 2019 revenue forecast to $85M - 87M from $80M and non-GAAP EBITDA to $38M - 40M from $34M.
    • Shares are up 17% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • RPD

    Rapid7 +1.3% on Outperform start

    • Baird initiates Rapid7 (NASDAQ:RPD) at Outperform with a $58 price target.
    • Yesterday, Rapid7 announced the acquisition of network visibility solution provider NetFort.
    • Rapid7 shares are up 1.3% after hours to $54.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • DBVT

    DBV Tech launches equity offering

    • DBV Technologies (NASDAQ:DBVT) initiates a global offering of up to 5,217,392 ordinary shares, possibly in the form of American Depositary Shares. Underwriters over-allotment will be an additional 782,608 shares. Price and terms have yet to be released.
    • Shares are down a fraction after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • TST

    TheStreet +5.2% on cash distribution, 1-for-10 reverse split

    • TheStreet (NASDAQ:TST) has announced a special cash distribution in connection with approval of a 1-for-10 reverse split of common stock.
    • Shares are up 5.2% after hours.
    • The cash distribution is about $94.3M, coming to $1.77/share, funded in part by proceeds from selling its B2B business to Euromoney. Cash on hand after the distribution will be about $18.5M-$21.5M.
    • The board has approved a plan of partial liquidation of its B2B operations, and so part of the distribution will be treated as partial liquidation for tax purposes, and part as a non-dividend distribution.
    • The company is changing its fiscal and tax year to end on March 31, effective now.
    • The reverse split will be effective with the open on April 26; the shares held by a common stockholder will be automatically converted to be divided by 10, with cash in lieu of fractional shares. That move will reduce total shares outstanding from 53.3M to about 5.3M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSPR

    InspireMD down 22% after hours on stock offering

    • InspireMD (NYSEMKT:NSPR) slumps 22% after hours in reaction to its planned public stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • ASND

    Ascendis Pharma reports FY results

    • Ascendis Pharma (NASDAQ:ASND): FY GAAP EPS of -€3.17.
    • Revenue of €10.58M (+591.5% Y/Y)
    • Shares +2.01%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • AVEO

    AVEO Pharma down 23% after hours on stock offering

    • AVEO Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVEO) slumps 23% after hours in response to its planned stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 20 Comments
  • SGMO

    Sangamo down 5% after hours on equity offering

    • Sangamo Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SGMO) slips 5% after hours in reaction to its planned stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 19 Comments

  • Zayo +4% on report sale process moving with multiple bidders

    • Zayo Group (ZAYO +4.1%) has legged higher this afternoon after a StreetInsider report that a sale of the company is moving forward with multiple bidders still engaged.
    • At least four are in the running for Zayo, with offers of $32-$34/share for the company as a whole, according to the report.
    • Bids for at least part of Zayo are due next Friday.
    • Updated 4:06 p.m.: Bloomberg points to a dealReporter item saying Zayo is in advanced talks with an infrastructure consortium that includes EQT, Digital Colony, and Omers. Shares closed at $29.30 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 7 Comments
  • PCFP

    Apotheca to change tickers tomorrow

    • Citing the need for a ticker that reflects its connection to the cannabidiol (CBD) industry, Apotheca Biosciences (OTCPK:PCFP +18.8%) will change its ticker to "CBDC" effective tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • GBTC

    Crypto rally continues

    • It's now day two of the great crypto bounce of 2019, with Bitcoin (BTC-USD) higher by another 5.25% to $5,164. That's up about 25% in two sessions, and the big cheese's highest price since late November.
    • Ether (ETH-USD), Ripple (XRP-USD), Bitcoin Cash (BCH-USD), and Litecoin (LTC-USD) are making even bigger moves, with BCH up 40% just today, and Litecoin up 23%.
    • Mike Novogratz chimes in, arguging that Litecoin has gotten far too pricey in relation to Bitcoin. He'd sell LTC to buy BTC.
    • OTCQX:GBTC +12.3% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 45 Comments

  • Amazon wants millions for Roku rival

    • Amazon (AMZN +0.4%) is asking advertisers to commit millions to a content expansion for its streaming service, according to Cheddar sources. The talks include media execs and ad agencies, and Amazon is asking for commitments that rival a large cable network.
    • Amazon wants to add more add-supported streaming channels to compete with Roku (ROKU -2.4%).
    • Advertisers are wary of pledging big bucks without knowing what content will be included, but Amazon is still in negotiations with the content providers.
    • The new content is expected to arrive on Fire TVs this fall.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 117 Comments
  • BURG

    Chanticleer Holdings executes exclusive partnership with DoorDash

    • Chanticleer Holdings (BURG +2.2%) says that it has entered into an exclusive partnership with DoorDash.
    • DoorDash is a technology company that connects customers with their favorite local and national businesses in over 3,300 cities and all 50 states across the U.S. and Canada.
    • Fred Glick, Chanticleer Holdings President: “....This partnership is expected to help minimize costs associated with delivery while creating an entirely new revenue vertical for our brands"
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM

  • Caleres and Shoe Carnival seen riding high with Nike

    • Wedbush stays positive on Nike (NKE) on its view the company's strong product pipeline will keep growth percolating. Analyst Christopher Svezia and team keep an Outperform rating on the Swoosh.
    • The good run for Nike is also seen benefiting Shoe Carnival (SCVL -2.3%) and Caleres (CAL +1.1%) with same-store sales growth. Both retailers are rated at Outperform. The firm assigns a price target of $47 to SCVL to rep 48% upside potential and $36 PT on CAL to rep 44% upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • AA

    Alcoa downgraded to Neutral, Chalco upgraded to Buy at BAML

    • BofA Merrill Lynch downgrades Alcoa (AA +0.2%) to Neutral from Buy with a $31 price target, cut from $45, but upgrades Aluminum Corp. of China (ACH +7.3%) to Buy from Neutral.
    • BAML analyst Timna Tanners sees limited free cash flow payments by Alcoa to upstream AWAC joint venture partner Alumina Ltd., potential excess alumina and bauxite supply, and potential price risks from a restart of the Alunorte refinery.
    • The firm cuts its aluminum price forecast by 5%-6% for 2019 and 2020, and believes Chinese exports will cap potential price gains, benefiting ACH, whose shares have been under pressure for the past 12 months and now fully reflect balance sheet concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • RIOT

    AMD, QTT and VERI among tech movers

    • Gainers: Riot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT) +14%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) +14%. AstroNova (NASDAQ:ALOT) +11%. Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) +9%. VivoPower International (NASDAQ:VVPR) +9%.
    • Losers: Fusion Connect (NASDAQ:FSNN) -82%. Phunware (NASDAQ:PHUN) -57%. Super League Gaming (NASDAQ:SLGG) -9%. Qutoutiao (NASDAQ:QTT) -8%. RigNet (NASDAQ:RNET) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • APC

    Colorado senate passes oil and gas overhaul bill, headed to governor

    • A sweeping overhaul of Colorado's oil and natural gas laws that gives local governments more power to regulate drilling is headed to the governor's desk after the state senate today approved amendments made in the House.
    • The Senate vote was 19-16, strictly on party lines with all Democrats voting yes and all Republicans voting no.
    • The shale boom has raised Colorado to the no. 5 oil producer in the U.S., ahead of Alaska and California, but proximity of oil and gas development to Denver’s suburbs raised concerns about health and safety after an Anadarko gas line explosion in 2017 killed two people and leveled a home.
    • Greater local control over regulating oil and gas operations, including the citing of drilling locations, likely will place some acreage out of reach for energy companies, analysts say.
    • Oil and gas firms with a presence in Colorado's Denver-Julesburg Basin are mostly lower: APC -2.6%, NBL -2.5%, XOG +0.3%, PDCE -1.6%, SRCI +1%, BCEI -2.3%, HPR -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 38 Comments

  • Tech gains as semis hit record

    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index jumps as much as 3% today to a record high on rising hopes of a US-China trade deal and bullish reports on AMD, Intel, and TSMC.
    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) is up 0.8%, the S&P 500 IT gains 0.8%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 is up 0.6%.
    • Related semiconductor ETFs: SOXL, SOXX, SMH, USD, PSI, XSD, SOXS, SSG, FTXL, XTH
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • KMT

    Kennametal upgraded at Barclays, says FCF margins to double over 2-3 years

    • Kennametal (KMT +1.9%) moves higher after Barclays upgrades shares to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $44 price target, raised from $38, seeing free cash flow margins doubling over the next 2-3 years.
    • KMT's sales have been slowing for 18 months but that it is now "near trough," says Barclays analyst Julian Mitchell, also noting the stock is trading at a 17% discount on price-to-earnings, relative to the comparable point of its prior upturns.
    • Mitchell also thinks KMT is executing well on its modernization program, "for which investors appear to be giving no credit."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAK

    Braskem -2% after request to freeze some assets

    • Braskem (BAK -2.2%) shares are on pace for their worst two-day slump since November following news that authorities in Brazil's Alagoas state requested the freezing of ~6.7B reais of the company's assets in the wake of the recent incident at the chlor-alkali plant.
    • Analysts from the Planner brokerage say the decision is a headwind for BAK and already was reflected in the stock's poor performance yesterday.
    • Today's trading volume is well more than double the stock's 20-day average.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • SPR

    Spirit AeroSystems -5% as Cowen cuts on risk from 737 MAX groundings

    • Spirit Aerosystems (SPR -4.9%) sinks to its lowest level since late January after Cowen downgrades shares to Market Perform from Outperform with a $95 price target.
    • Cowen's Cai von Rumohr says increased potential for a rate adjustment for the Boeing 737 MAX aircraft likely will offset the expected upside from the Asco acquisition.
    • With a lower 2020 cash flow yield than Boeing and less pricing power, the analyst says SPR looks fairly priced.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM

  • Amyris and Key Energy Services among Energy/Materials gainers; Tengasco and Matador Resources among losers

    • Gainers: Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS) +15%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +13%. ZK International Group (NASDAQ:ZKIN) +11%. SenesTech (NASDAQ:SNES) +11%. Pioneer Energy Services (NYSE:PES) +8%.
    • Losers: Tengasco (NYSEMKT:TGC) -8%. Matador Resources (NYSE:MTDR) -8%. SM Energy (NYSE:SM) -6%. Sanchez Midstream Partners (NYSEMKT:SNMP) -6%. Mexco Energy (NYSEMKT:MXC) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • KURA

    Kura up 1% on tipifarnib data

    • Kura Oncology (KURA +1.3%) is up on below-average volume following the presentation of new data supporting the mechanism of action of lead drug tipifarnib at AACR in Atlanta.
    • Tipifarnib is inhibits an enzyme called farnesyltransferase which plays a key role in cell cycle progression. Since cancer is defined as unregulated cell proliferation, inhibiting the enzyme would theoretically inhibit cancer progression.
    • The company is currently conducting a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating tipifarnib in patients with HRAS mutation-positive head and neck cancer. HRAS is an exclusively farnesylated oncogene (considered to cause cancer).
    • In tumor models and cancer patients, tipifarnib has shown to downregulate the production of a signaling protein called CXCL12.
    • The data presented at AACR suggests that gene expression of certain exclusively farnesylated proteins is strongly associated with CXCL12 expression in bone marrow cells, supporting the rationale of farnesyl transferase inhibition. It also supports the rationale of using CXCL12 as a biomarker for potential clinical benefit.
    • Piper's Tyler Van Buren is an early cheerleader, convinced that tipifarnib will be a winner. He rates the stock Overweight with a $25 (33% upside) price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • JRVR

    Uber insurer James River Group drops after rating cut

    • James River Group (NASDAQ:JRVR) sinks 4.9%, the biggest intraday decline at least four months, after Compass Point analyst Bijan Moazami writes that there are "too many concerns" to save the insurer's buy rating.
    • Cut to neutral; price target to $39 from $47.
    • Its dependence on its largest account, Uber, which "will likely go away" as of March 1, 2020 figures prominently, Moazami writes.
    1. Uber accounts for almost 45% of gross written premiums in James River Group's excess & surplus lines segment.
    2. Also "uncomfortably large dependence" on BB&T as a producer and "poor reputation" of Atlas General Insurance, which is in a fronting pact with James River, present concerns.
    • Analyst ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • CTXS

    Citrix hires Goldman for potential sale - NYP

    • Citrix Systems (NASDAQ:CTXS) pops 5.4% after the New York Post reports the company has hired Goldman Sachs for a potential sale.
    • Citrix wants a buyer willing to pay more than $15B.
    • Goldman is reaching out to logical targets like PE firm Vista Equity Partners.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 4 Comments
  • FB

    Bloomberg: Facebook user records stored publicly on AWS servers

    • Facebook (FB +0.9%) has trimmed gains after Bloomberg headlines noting millions of user records were found to be stored publicly on Amazon Web Services servers.
    • Shares were up as much as 2.2% before the reports took some air out.
    • Facebook worked with Amazon to take the data down, Bloomberg says.
    • Updated: The report says researchers at UpGuard found the information hiding on plain sight on the cloud servers.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 103 Comments
  • OESX

    Orion secures additional $35M LED lighting installation contract

    • Orion Energy Systems (OESX +16.7%) announced it has expanded the retrofit of a major national account customer’s lighting systems with Orion’s state-of-the-art LED lighting and wireless IoT enabled control solutions at additional locations nationwide.
    • Orion anticipates additional revenue of $35M under the contract, which is dependent on the customer's issuance of purchase orders.
    • A significant portion of the installations are expected to be completed in FY20 first quarter ending June 30, 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTCH

    Match bull sees "sustainable" growth

    • Jefferies says Match Group (NASDAQ:MTCH) should deliver "sustainable" mid to high teen growth for revenue and high 30% for margins.
    • Though it thinks Match can't maintain last year's 30% growth, Jefferies sees a "robust" international opportunity as the company throws more weight into under-penetrated regions like India and Japan.
    • Rating maintained at Buy with a $64 PT.
    • Match shares are up 1.6% to $57.57.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 7 Comments

  • LM Funding America leads financial gainers; IRSA Inversiones the only losers

    • Gainers: LM Funding America (NASDAQ:LMFA) +10%. MoneyGram International (NASDAQ:MGI) +10%. Ocwen Financial (NYSE:OCN) +7%. Nicholas Financial (NASDAQ:NICK) +7%. Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) +6%.
    • Losers: IRSA Inversiones y Representaciones Sociedad Anonima (NYSE:IRS) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM

  • Ocean Power Technologies leads industrial gainers; Forterra leads the losers

    • Gainers: Ocean Power Technologies (NASDAQ:OPTT) +196%. DMC Global (NASDAQ:BOOM) +19%. Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK) +17%. Jason Industries (NASDAQ:JASN) +6%. LSI Industries (NASDAQ:LYTS) +6%.
    • Losers: Forterra (NASDAQ:FRTA) -7%. Legacy Housing (NASDAQ:LEGH) -7%. Intelligent Systems (NYSEMKT:INS) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • PRSP

    Perspecta +3.6% on DARPA contract

    • Perspecta's (NYSE:PRSP) research arm receives a $4.8M contract option for the second phase of the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency's information security program.
    • Perspecta shares are up 3.6% to $21.58.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment

  • Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Ocean Power Technologies (NASDAQ:OPTT) +176%. Netshoes (Cayman) (NYSE:NETS) +23%. Evogene (NASDAQ:EVGN) +22%. Zynerba Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ZYNE) +21%. DMC Global (NASDAQ:BOOM) +19%. Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK) +18%. VivoPower International (NASDAQ:VVPR) +15%. Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) +16%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +16%. China Eastern Airlines Corporation (NYSE:CEA) +16%.
    • Losers: Fusion Connect (NASDAQ:FSNN) -81%. Obalon Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OBLN) -41%. Advaxis (NASDAQ:ADXS) -30%. Pulmatrix (NASDAQ:PULM) -14%. SG Blocks (NASDAQ:SGBX) -10%. PhaseBio Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PHAS) -10%. Dean Foods (NYSE:DF) -9%. Neon Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NTGN) -9%. Legacy Housing (NASDAQ:LEGH) -8%. Tengasco (NYSEMKT:TGC) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • NLSN

    Nielsen jumps 6.2% on word P-E sale is close

    • After hanging on steady 1% gains most of today, Nielsen Holdings (NYSE:NLSN) has spiked 6.2% amid chatter that it's close to a deal to sell to private equity.
    • That would come via a final-round bid said to be in the low-$30 range for shares, which are currently up to $25.59.
    • A squeeze may be on after some heavy short-sale volume.
    • StreetInsider says two P-E firms submitted bids.
    • Previously: Nielsen -9.5% amid weaker case for sale (Mar. 28 2019)
    • Previously: Nielsen -10% on report Blackstone's out of auction for company (Mar. 27 2019)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • TME

    Report: China probes Tencent Music over antitrust concern

    • Tencent Music Entertainment (TME +1.9%) is under investigation regarding potential market dominance in China, Capitol Forum reports.
    • That news caused a quick loss of nearly all of today's gains, though shares quickly recovered in part. They're still off their peak of $19.42.
    • China's State Administration for Market Regulation is examining antitrust issues, according to the report.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 7 Comments
  • CMC

    Commercial Metals +5% as Credit Suisse rates top pick among steel stocks

    • Commercial Metals (CMC +5.2%) climbs to three-month highs after Credit Suisse raises its FY 2020 estimates following meetings with company management.
    • Credit Suisse analyst Curt Woodworth, who calls CMC a top pick across the steel universe, says he has increased confidence in H2 earnings growth and upside from unrealized synergies from the Gerdau assets.
    • Woodworth says CMC's major headwind in FY 2019 is clearly the FAB segment, which had negative annualized EBITDA of ~$150M in Q1, but CMC noted new FAB contracts pricing at EBITDA margins of $60/ton, and he estimates as high as $100/ton for more recent deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • LYFT

    Lyft "most expensive" borrow on short surge

    • Yesterday was the first day investors could borrow Lyft (NASDAQ:LYFT) shares to settle short sales, and the demand increased the cost of a short stake by 100%, according to IHS Markit data.
    • In the overnight reports, 6.61M shares were reported on loan with a $455M market value.
    • The surge made Lyft the "most expensive to borrow" U.S. stock with more than $5M in balances.
    • Lyft shares are up 2.8% to $70.93.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 36 Comments

  • Adient and Delphi Technologies among consumer gainers; Dean Foods leads the losers

    • Gainers: Village Farms International (NASDAQ:VFF) +11%. e.l.f. Beauty (NYSE:ELF) +10%. Veoneer (NYSE:VNE) +8%. Delphi Technologies (NYSE:DLPH) +7%. Adient (NYSE:ADNT) +7%.
    • Losers: Dean Foods (NYSE:DF) -9%. Celsius Holdings (NASDAQ:CELH) -6%. Natural Health Trends (NASDAQ:NHTC) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • OKTA

    Okta +4% on analyst day praise

    • Canaccord Genuity maintains a Buy rating on Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) and raises its PT from $85 to $95 after the analyst day event.
    • The firm says it continues "to construct a realistic scenario in which OKTA delivers a multi-year run of double-digit returns" but sees the stock's valuation "at the high end of a reasonable range" even on "stretch assumptions."
    • More action: Goldman Sachs reiterates a Buy rating and $94 PT saying that "Okta’s competitive advantage remains years ahead of the competition."
    • Okta shares are up 4.2% to $89.39.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 8 Comments
  • ZYNE

    Zynerba adds to up move; shares ahead 16%

    • Zynerba Pharmaceuticals (ZYNE +16%) is up on a 4x surge in volume, adding to yesterday's 20% jump after it announced an upcoming corporate presentation at H.C. Wainwright Global Health Sciences Conference on April 9.
    • A key looming catalyst is a data readout later this year from a Phase 2/3 clinical trial evaluating ZYN002, a cannabinoid transdermal gel, in patients with Fragile X syndrome.
    • On the working capital front, at year-end 2018, it had $59.8M in cash and equivalents while operations consumed $32.4M during the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 13 Comments

  • Zynerba Pharmaceuticals and Sorrento Therapeutics among healthcare gainers; Advaxis and AVEO Pharmaceuticals among losers

    • Gainers: Evogene (NASDAQ:EVGN) +28%. Zynerba Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ZYNE) +18%. InspireMD (NYSEMKT:NSPR) +15%. Sorrento Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRNE) +13%. Aytu BioScience (NASDAQ:AYTU) +12%.
    • Losers: Obalon Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OBLN) -39%. Advaxis (NASDAQ:ADXS) -31%. AVEO Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVEO) -13%. TrovaGene (NASDAQ:TROV) -9%. AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • MGI

    MoneyGram +11% on Northland confidence

    • MoneyGram International (NASDAQ:MGI) jumps 11.10% after Northland Securities upgrades the payments firm to an Outperform rating from Market Perform on a positive view of upside potential for shares.
    • "We believe a little good news can move MGI to a 5.0x multiple," says Northland analyst Mike Grondahl.
    • Northland assigns a Street-high price target of $5.50 on MoneyGram vs. the 52-week range of $1.59 to $8.85.

  • EXFO

  • IOVA

    Iovance Bio up 6% on pipeline update

    • Iovance Biotherapeutics (IOVA +6.1%) is up on below-average volume after its update on its infiltrating lymphocyte (TIL) clinical programs in cervical cancer and non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
    • Cervical cancer: Enrollment has been increased to 59 (from 47) in a Phase 2 clinical trial, C-145-04, evaluating lead candidate LN-145. The primary endpoint of objective response rate (ORR) has been modified based on prior FDA interactions with lifileucel in melanoma. The specific changes are not provided but the company says it will update investors on the registration path later this year.
    • NSCLC: Citing advances in standard-of-care treatment, the Phase 2 IOV-LUN-201 trial of LN-145, combined with AstraZeneca's (AZN -1.5%) Imfinzi (durvalumab), will be terminated and a new arm will be added to the Phase 2 IOV-COM-202 solid tumor study. The new arm will allow PD-1/L1-naive NSCLC patients to receive the combination of LN-145 and Merck's (MRK +0.3%) Keytruda (pembrolizumab).

    Inovio up 1% on encouraging INO-3106 results

    • Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +1.4%) is up on light volume in early trade on the heels of results from a pilot study of INO-3106 in two patients with recurrent respiratory papillomatosis, a rare HPV-associated disease characterized by persistent noncancerous tumor growths in the airways. The data were presented at AACR in Atlanta.
    • Surgery to remove the growths, usually multiple times each year, is the only current treatment.
    • Following their last dose of INO-3106, a non-invasive immunotherapy, both patients have been surgery-free, one for two years and the other for one year.
    • Development is ongoing.

  • Intelsat +7% as JPMorgan upgrades on C-Band potential

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) is up 7% premarket following an upgrade to Overweight at JPMorgan, which sees the potential for "substantial" proceeds from spectrum sales by the company and its C-Band Alliance.
    • Some kind of market-based approach will move that spectrum from the C-Band Alliance (which includes SES (OTCPK:SGBAF)) into the hands of wireless carriers over the next five years, analyst Philip Cusick writes. And FCC approval could come as soon as mid-year though it will likely take longer.
    • His base case has 180 MHz overall being sold to carriers (AT&T, T-Mobile and "motivated" Verizon) for $0.25/MHz-POP, or $15B. Intelsat's allocation is currently about 45%. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • His price target is $27, implying 76% upside.

  • APTX

    Aptinyx up 13% premarket on NYX-458 data in Parkinson's

    • Aptinyx (NASDAQ:APTX) is up 13% premarket on robust volume in reaction to preclinical data on its NMDA receptor modulator NYX-458. The results were presented at the International Conference on Alzheimer's & Parkinson's Diseases in Lisbon, Portugal.
    • In a non-human primate model of Parkinson's disease, a single dose of NYX-458 produced significant sustainable improvements in cognitive performance across a battery of tests. When administered alone or with levodopa, there were no adverse effects on motor symptoms or observed interference with levodopa. No tolerability issued were reported.
    • Results from a Phase 1 in-human study assessing the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and CNS exposure of NYX-458 should be available later this quarter. A Phase 2 should launch in H2.
